data.benefits: Scheme will provide one-time cash benifit of Rs 0.10 lakh for pre-incubation program.
data.eligibility:
The entity should : 

  • Be a separate legal entity with operations not exceeding 10 years. 
  • Have Annual turnover less than Rs. 100 crore since incorporation. 
  • Not be formed by splitting/reconstruction or part of a family business/conglomerate.
data.conditions:
• Should be recognized by the Uttarakhand Startup Task Force. 
  • Entity shall have an office in Uttarakhand and should have significant operation of business from Uttarakhand. 
  • Entity shall be employ at least 70% of its overall full-time workforce (workforce shall include founder, cofounders, support staff, skilled staff working on company payroll) having a domicile of Uttarakhand during the entire period of recognition.
data.beneficiaries:
The entity should : 

  • Be a separate legal entity with operations not exceeding 10 years. 
  • Have Annual turnover less than Rs. 100 crore since incorporation. 
  • Not be formed by splitting/reconstruction or part of a family business/conglomerate.
data.prerequisites:
• Should be recognized by the Uttarakhand Startup Task Force. 
  • Entity shall have an office in Uttarakhand and should have significant operation of business from Uttarakhand. 
  • Entity shall be employ at least 70% of its overall full-time workforce (workforce shall include founder, cofounders, support staff, skilled staff working on company payroll) having a domicile of Uttarakhand during the entire period of recognition.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Industries, Department of MSME
data.context: In the wake of the drastic changes in the economic environment as result of pandemic across the world, it has become inevitable to design exemplary measures to support home grown startup enterprises. Thus, with an objective to address the need of promoting innovations and entrepreneurship in solving the complex societal problems and to support key stakeholders of startup ecosystem, the "Uttarakhand Startup Policy 2023‚Äù has been  brought in to force.
data.objective: The objective of this policy is to create a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship by establishing a robust startup ecosystem in the state.
data.description:
Innovators or aspiring entrepreneurs or women/student entrepreneurs or startups with grassroot impact or innovator/entrepreneurs working in disruptive sector identified by the State Nodal Agency shall be eligible for a one time free of cost incubation support to provide them mentoring support and handhold them for product development. 

Pre-incubation program will be organized through reputed incubation centre or accelerators which shall be identified by State Nodal Agency from time to time. The pre-incubation support shall be a one-time support for a maximum period of four months. The cost up to Rs 0.10 lakh per incubate shall be borne by the State Nodal Agency towards the pre-incubation program.
data.how_to_apply:
The applicant can apply through the below link:
https://startuputtarakhand.uk.gov.in/signup
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Industries, Department of MSME
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentive after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
Startups working on disruptive technologies 

The qualification of startups working on disruptive technologies are as follows: Startups working on futuristic technologies: Startups that are working on futuristic technologies such as Neural Language Processing (NLP), Drones, Robotics, Defence, Aerospace, Space technologies, Fintech, MedTech, Healthtech to provide innovative solutions to the problem or challenges existing in the society or country. 

Startups working on Renewable energy: Startups helping to reduce carbon footprints through a renewable and sustainable source of energy using clean technologies or solutions such as Solar energy, Wind energy, Hydro energy, Tidal energy, Geothermal energy, Biomass energy etc.

 Startups working on Climate Change: Startups working in the area of eco-friendly and/or climate-friendly technologies/solutions that helps in reducing and offsetting carbon emissions or increasing the green cover in the region.

 Startup working on Circular Economy: Startups working in the four Rs of the circular economy namely: 

(a.) Reuse: Cloth collection, circular fashion, second-hand products etc.

 (b.) Recycle: Recycled plastic, bottles, construction with recyclable materials etc.

 (c.) Reduce: Packagingwith sustainable material, edible cutlery etc. 

(d.) Remove: Urbanfarming, use offossil fuel, carbon capturing etc.

 Startup working on Sustainability: A startup working on green and sustainable practices along with next generation cutting edge technologies, processes or solutions that are enabling the world at large to recover from years of overuse such as

 (a.) improving the soil's health

 (b.) protection of endangered species

 (c.) protection of the ocean's biodiversity

 (d.) clean technologies for alternative energy sources

 (e.) clean technologies for water conservation and ground water recharging 

(f.) plantation and conservation of trees to increase green cover in particular region

 (g.) disaster management etc.
data.checklist_info_a:
-Basic KYC documents 
-ITR, P&L, B/S of last 3 FY and current FY (Till date) 
-Business incorporation letter / Company registration certificate 
-CIBIL Report 
-Business Project Report 
-Business Plan (Business model, promoter profile, and projected financials)
